reference.title: Tagging XML
reference.shortdesc: The CWRC-Writer allows editors of documents to mark up or embed semantic tags in documents using Extensible Markup Language (XML).

refbody.section: Introduction to tagging XMLCWRC-Writer uses both the terms markup and tag to describe the embedding of XML (Extensible Markup Language) tags within the text of a document according to a predefined structure or schema. (For a gentel introduction to XML see http://www.w3schools.com/xml/). The markup or encoding makes the tagged features of the document available for search, analysis, and formatting while also ensuring that the text remains in a readily preservable format.

Document templates and sample documents contain some basic tags. The exisiting markup in your active document can be seen in the Markup panel. For more information see Navigation panelsThere are three different tabs on the left hand side of CWRC-Writer.. You can add text to or delete it from the pre-existing tags, change the tags, and/or you can add new tags. For example, in the poetry template there are "lg" and "l" tags, into which you can type or copy text.

link.linktext: Adding structural tags by selecting text
link.desc: In each document that you work with there is a pre-existing XML template that contains the basic tags necessary for that type of document. You can add new structural tags to the document easily.

link.linktext: Adding structural tags in the structural panel
link.desc: In each document that you enter there is a pre-existing XML template that contains the basic tags necessary for that type document. You can add new structural tags to the document easily.
The document template that you are working with may have existing tags that you do not need for your document. You can easily delete these tags following these steps.

link.linktext: Deleting tags using the CWRC-Writer toolbar
link.desc: The document template that you are working with may have existing tags that you do not need for your document. You can easily delete these tags following these steps.
You can edit any of the tags that pre-exist in the template or that you have added to the document. This also allows you to add contextual information to the tags in your document .

link.linktext: Editing tags in the structure panel
link.desc: You can edit any of the tags that pre-exist in the template or that you have added to the document. This also allows you to add contextual information through attributes.

link.linktext: Editing tags using the CWRC-Writer toolbar
link.desc: You can edit any of the tags that pre-exist in the template or that you have added to the document. This also allows you to add additional information to the tags in your document (E.g. next, rend, etc.).
